column1: Thank you for contacting Netwrix Technical Support. My name is Lusine and Iâ€™ll be the engineer assisting you with this ticket.
As per description you want to copy files to a USB from one  EY MAC machine and try to access it from another EY MAC machine.
For me to be able to help accordingly, please confirm if this query is related to NDC for which this ticket was opened and share below information.
1. What files do you want to copy from NDC? (please share a full screen screenshot)
2. May I know why do you want to copy the files? What is the final goal?
Please provide as many details as possible so I could fully understand your situation and respond to your query accordingly.

Thank you for contacting Netwrix Technical Support. My name is Lusine and I’ll be the engineer assisting you with this ticket.
As per description you want to copy files to a USB from one  EY MAC machine and try to access it from another EY MAC machine.

We want to know what happens when an EY user copy files from an EY mac machine installed with EPP to a USB and tries to open the copied files from another EY Mac machine installed with EPP.
Will the users be prompted for password even if the EPP agent is installed and healthy.
We are performing this for testing purposes.
Jasir Mohamed S | Endpoint Operations | Endpoint & Cloud Security Technology | STS | Information Security | EY Technology
Ground Floor, Drishya , Kinfrapark,, Trivandrum 695585, Kerala, GDS - India
To: Jasir Mohamed S <Jasir.Mohamed@gds.ey.com>; Paul.Trufanoff@netwrix.com; Alexey.Mordovsky@netwrix.com

We want to know what happens when an EY user copy files from an EY mac machine installed with EPP to a USB and tries to open the copied files from another EY Mac machine installed with EPP.
Will the users be prompted for password even if the EPP agent is installed and healthy.
We are performing this for testing purposes.

Jasir","Netwrix Support Ticket #442269 - Data copy from One EY MAC machine to Another","jasir.mohamed@gds.ey.com","Jasir mohamed","techsupport@netwrix.com","","","false","2025-04-17T11:14:03.000Z","true"
As your question is related to Endpoint Protector, I'll be happy to help here.

The user is required to input the password defined for a specific USB device regrdless if the EPP client is present or not (in the case you choose to allow users to access encrypted data on computers where the EPP client is not present by turning off the Endpoint Protector Client presence required setting available for the Global level under Device Control > Global Settings > ""Easylock Settings"" section or granular at Group/ Computer/ User level under Device Control > Groups/ Computers/ Users > right click in the entity > Manage Settings > ""Easylock Settings"" section).
Please let me know if I can help with other details.
Cc: Oana Nemes <oana.nemes@netwrix.com>; Alif Wahid <Alif.Wahid@gds.ey.com>; Sarath Narayanan <Sarath.Narayanan@gds.ey.com>; Doug Russell <Doug.Russell@ey.com>; Surej K P <Surej.KP@gds.ey.com>
